synchronizeSchema.title: Database schema columns
synchronizeSchema.description: SETTING THIS OPTION WILL DROP YOUR TABLE. In case your destination table has a schema incompatible with the dataset, you can provide a list of column names and their types, then the table will be synchronized according to your definitions by dropping and recreating the table. Key is the column name, value is the column type (as in SQL query, like VARCHAR). This is optional if your table already has the desired schema.

transformJsonKeyFunction.title: Transform JSON key function
transformJsonKeyFunction.description: Enter body of a function that will transform JSON keys of dataset objecs. You have access to 'key' argument and must return a string. Example: 'return key.toLowerCase()'

datasetId.title: Dataset ID
datasetId.description: Dataset of the ID to download the data from

tableName.title: Fully-qualified table name
tableName.description: Table name in the format DATABASE.SCHEMA.TABLENAME

account.title: Account name
account.description: Account name. You can get it from the url, it's usually a set of letters and is not the same as your username.

warehouse.title: Warehouse
warehouse.description: Supply your custom warehouse name if you want. The deault works fine as well.

overwrite.title: Overwrite table
overwrite.description: Whether to drop the table's data before pushing dataset data into it

flattenJson.title: Flatten JSON
flattenJson.description: If you select this option, instead of {a: {b: 1, c: [1, 2]}} you'll get {a.b: 1, a.c.0: 1, a.c.1: 2}

dataLossConfirmation.title: Confirm data loss
dataLossConfirmation.description: If you choose to synchronize your schema or overwrite previous data, check this checkbox to confirm that you agree to lose your previous data
